godisboxen.title: Akka, Pekko or what?
godisboxen.description:
The ones of us who enjoys writing Scala are most likely sad to hear about the license changes that Akka recently announced.Â Â 

The community has been fierce even if the licensing changes might make sense from a (lightbendâ€™s) business perspective, and recently thereâ€™s been an initiative started to build a Open Source version of Akka namedÂ [Pekko](https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/INCUBATOR/PekkoProposal)Â thatâ€™d reside under the Apache umbrella. Even with this initiative the future is unsure as first-movers advantage is a real thing and Pekko might simply slide into nothingness..

Whatâ€™s your opinion?

godisboxen.title: Java 19 ðŸ¥³
godisboxen.description:
Omg omg omg! Itâ€™s here, itâ€™s really here!Â Â 

Virtual Threads. Nuffâ€™ said!

  

Really, this update isÂ **huge**Â andÂ **Project Loom is finally merged**. What does it mean in practice though?  
Virtual Threads leans close toÂ _goroutines in golang_Â which is near-zero-overhead threads.Â   
Why is it huge though? Because this update affect ALL current thread usage across the JVM. That means your old blocking APIâ€™s are nowÂ _much more efficient_.Â   
  
Is it only Java with itâ€™s old blocking API that has gains to do? No, all new things like reactive approaches can tap into this power-source. So can Scala, Kotlin and more!

godisboxen.title: Outdated vs. Complete
godisboxen.description:
The App Stores are known to be vile in many cases. Hereâ€™s one such case where a Indie-Developer almost reach a soul-crushing amount of work to keep their apps up-to-date with the rules and guidelines of App Store(s).

If an app is complete the maintenance should, in my opinion,Â be close-to-zero but thatâ€™s not the case. Apple and others keep pushing more and more work onto the developers and theyâ€™re not afraid to deactivate apps making it even harder to get back in the game.

Read more about these problems in this great write-up!
